text: [Music]
hello I'm Tobias a cloud Support
Engineer here at the AWS office in
Dublin sometimes customers ask me how
they can export their Amazon lights a
linux-based and since to Amazon ec2 this
might be because the light sail instance
can successfully boot or can't be
accessed and manual troubleshooting is
needed or they want to use advanced ec2
features such as our the scaling port
based security groups Amazon EFS or
Amazon V PC another scenario might be
that you want to share or move your
light sale instance to another AWS
account a few things to keep in mind
before you start the export you won't
retain the IP address from your light
sale instance whether or not it's public
or private the export process only works
one way this means it's currently not
possible to export instances from ec2
back to light sale regardless of whether
we want to export your light sale
instance to ec2 or you want to
troubleshoot it the first steps are the
same let's get started
as you can see I'm already locked into
the AWS management console I'll navigate
to the light sale console
on the light sale homepage choose your
instance
choose snapshots if needed change the
name of your snapshot
and then choose create snapshot
you can see the snapshot you just
created in the recent snapshot section
it will appear as in progress this can
take a few minutes
choose the Action menu for the desire
snapshot then choose export Amazon ec2
review the important information details
displayed in the prompt if you agree to
export Amazon ec2 choose yes continue to
begin the process
acknowledged information regarding the
light sale keeper to continue
the export process can take a while and
depends on the size and configuration of
the source instance or block storage
disk use the task monitor in the light
share console to track the status of
your export you can access this
information from the top navigation pane
on all pages of the lightsail console
it's the two gears icon when the
snapshot is successfully exported choose
the option open the Amazon ec2 console
now the steps to follow to export the
light sevenson split into two scenarios
that were mentioned at the start
scenario a covers an instance that needs
troubleshooting and can't be accessed or
started scenario B creates a new ec2
instance from your light sailin sense
for scenario a follow these steps to
troubleshoot your instance or recover
data from a failed instance identify the
snapshot that the ami is referring to
the information is displayed on the
details and block devices at the bottom
of the screen
choose elastic block store and snapshots
in the navigation pane then filtered by
the snapshot ID from the previous step
choose actions and then create volume
for this purpose keep the default values
choose a name
and select create volume selecting the
volume ID displayed will bring you to
the volume right-click and then select
attach volume to attach this volume to
previously created easy to rescue
instance this is another newly created
ec2 instance that should be as similar
as possible to the instance that you
want to recover especially in regards to
the AMI and the operating system the
instance must also be in the same
availability zone as the EBS volume note
the device name which is slash def slash
SDF by default choose attached
establish an SSH connection to the
rescue instance we will switch to the
terminal for that
you
issued a command sudo mount slash staff
/xv df1 /mnt
be sure that this path is not already in
use some Linux distributions use other
names for example / - / + vm e 1 + 1 p 1
is used on nitro instances such as m 5 C
5 and T 3 you now have access to all the
files of your old lightsail instance
under /mnt for data recovery or
troubleshooting purposes
this concludes scenario a for scenario B
follow these steps to create an ec2
instance from the snapshot were back to
the ec2 console after exporting the
snapshot choose the ami created from the
export process and choose launch
you now have the option of customizing
your instance throughout steps 2 to 7 in
the console but no changes are mandatory
it's a best practice to create a name
tag for the instance in step 5 in the
console to identify the instance easily
later
after step 7 choose launch if this is
your first ec2 instance in this region
create a new key pair then download the
key pair to your computer make sure to
save the key pair you can easily find an
axis in the next step
then choose launch instances
choose the displayed instanceid to have
a look at the status of the instance
launch
it might take a moment for your instance
to become available
use potty or the integrated SSH client
in Mac OS or Linux to connect to your
imported instance this choice will vary
depending on your operating system make
sure to connect using the downloaded key
file for this step we will switch to the
terminal
you
edit the file dot SSH slash authorized
underscore keys in your home directory
identify the keeper names lightsail
default key pair and then remove it
from now on only your ec2 keeper can be
used to access this instance this will
avoid confusion in the future as to
which key pair to use to access the
instance make sure to leave the newly
created ec2 keeper in the configuration
file
you have successfully migrated your
lightsail instance to ec2 you can now
make use of the vast number of
additional services and options that you
see to offers this concludes scenario B
you
thanks for watching and happy cloud
computing from all of us here at AWS
[Music]
